name: Llama AI Model for Google Sheets Tracking

description:
How it works:

- Accesses a target website, searches for new PDFs, and downloads them automatically.
- Extracts content from each PDF and sends it to an AI for summarization.
- Delivers the AI-generated summary directly to a Discord channel.
- Marks processed URLs in Google Sheets to avoid duplicates.

Set up steps:

- Configure the website URL in the HTTP Request node.
- Connect to Google Cloud API (enable Drive & Sheets) and link your spreadsheet.
- Set up an OpenRouter API key and choose your preferred AI model.
- Create a Discord webhook for notifications.

parameters.text:
=Analyze the following company report and provide an executive summary in English, highlighting:

* Key financial information (if available)
* Relevant actions announced by the company
* Changes in the board of directors or other important decisions
* Any potential impact for investors

parameters.content: This is the AI process ‚Äî go in and change the prompt to your liking.

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
## Start

These blocks trigger the flow ‚Äî one is manual, and one is scheduled. Open them and set the frequency you want.

## Website Access and PDF Search

Open the first node that connects to the website and set it to the one you want.

## Google Connection

Here you need to connect to the Google Cloud API: [https://cloud.google.com/](https://cloud.google.com/) and enable both Drive and Sheets.
Then, create a sheet in Drive ‚Äî this will be the one you use.

## Model Connection
Here you need to register on OpenRouter and enter the API key. You can choose any model you like, as long as it‚Äôs free.

## Marking the Registered URLs

With this, I simply receive which URLs I‚Äôve downloaded the PDF from, and we mark them in the Google Sheet we created.

## Sending to Discord

In a private Discord server, create a channel. In the channel settings, create an integration via webhook and paste it here.

main.node: Append or update row in sheet
